<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 384, 390, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: List of formulae (MF19)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 419, 225, 435]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 275, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 450, 763, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 466, 809, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 482, 566, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 498, 487, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 513, 364, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 528, 870, 558]]<|/det|>
If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 558, 484, 573]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 573, 885, 603]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 603, 860, 633]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 666, 215, 680]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 682, 388, 697]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 75.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 697, 732, 713]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 78, 97, 97]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 897, 107]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(2^{3x - 1} = 5(3^{1 - x})\). Give your answer in the form \(\frac{\ln a}{\ln b}\) where \(a\) and \(b\) are integers.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 100, 920, 118]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
The equation of a curve is \(y = \sin x \sin 2x\). The curve has a stationary point in the interval \(0 < x < \frac{1}{2}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 104, 803, 123]]<|/det|>
Find the \(x\)-coordinate of this point, giving your answer correct to 3 significant figures.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 108]]<|/det|>
Express \(4\cos x - \sin x\) in the form \(R\cos (x + \alpha)\), where \(R > 0\) and \(0^{\circ}< \alpha < 90^{\circ}\). State the exact value of \(R\) and give \(\alpha\) correct to 2 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 528, 185, 546]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 528, 670, 546]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(4\cos 2x - \sin 2x = 3\) for \(0^{\circ}< x< 180^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 528, 920, 546]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(z^{2} - 6\mathrm{i}z - 12 = 0\), giving the answers in the form \(x + \mathrm{i}y\), where \(x\) and \(y\) are real and exact.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 594, 186, 612]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 594, 920, 628]]<|/det|>
On a sketch of an Argand diagram with origin \(O\), show points \(A\) and \(B\) representing the roots of the equation in part (a).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 612, 920, 629]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 74, 146, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 566, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the exact modulus and argument of each root.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 74, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 544, 186, 562]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[186, 544, 544, 562]]<|/det|>
Hence show that the triangle \(OAB\) is equilateral.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 543, 920, 562]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 811, 92]]<|/det|>
Hence find the area of triangle \(ABC\). Give your answer in a simplified exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 97, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 544, 92]]<|/det|>
The variables \(x\) and \(\theta\) satisfy the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[384, 100, 613, 131]]<|/det|>
\[x\sin^{2}\theta \frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}\theta} = \tan^{2}\theta -2\cot \theta ,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 139, 594, 160]]<|/det|>
for \(0 < \theta < \frac{1}{2}\pi\) and \(x > 0\). It is given that \(x = 2\) when \(\theta = \frac{1}{4}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 180, 146, 199]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 175, 426, 203]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d}\theta} (\cot^2\theta) = -\frac{2\cot\theta}{\sin^2\theta}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 218, 922, 240]]<|/det|>
(You may assume without proof that the derivative of \(\cot \theta\) with respect to \(\theta\) is \(-\cosec^2\theta\).) [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 529, 186, 548]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 528, 692, 549]]<|/det|>
Solve the differential equation and find the value of \(x\) when \(\theta = \frac{1}{6}\pi\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 529, 918, 548]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[306, 87, 717, 255]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 272, 920, 308]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows part of the curve \(y = \sin \sqrt{x}\). This part of the curve intersects the \(x\)-axis at the point where \(x = a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 319, 148, 337]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 319, 366, 337]]<|/det|>
State the exact value of \(a\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 319, 918, 337]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 463, 148, 481]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 463, 920, 496]]<|/det|>
Using the substitution \(u = \sqrt{x}\), find the exact area of the shaded region in the first quadrant bounded by this part of the curve and the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 477, 920, 496]]<|/det|>
<mark>[7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 73, 475, 91]]<|/det|>
Verify by calculation that \(0.5 < \theta < 0.7\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 510, 186, 528]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 510, 920, 545]]<|/det|>
Use an iterative formula based on the equation in part (a) to determine \(\theta\) correct to 3 decimal places. Give the result of each iteration to 5 decimal places.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 528, 920, 546]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]
